senses.sense_definition: A person who observes someone or something closely, often as a hobby or for professional analysis.

examples.text: The avid bird <w>watcher</w> traveled to the forest to see the rare owl.
As a long-time market <w>watcher</w>, she knew exactly when to sell her stocks.

senses.sense_definition: A person assigned to guard a place or keep watch for danger.

examples.text: The silent <w>watcher</w> on the wall signaled that riders were approaching.
He stood as a lonely <w>watcher</w> at the gate throughout the cold night.

senses.sense_definition: An official representative who observes an election to ensure it is conducted fairly and according to the rules.

examples.text: Each political party sent a poll <w>watcher</w> to monitor the counting of votes.
The election <w>watcher</w> reported several irregularities at the voting station.

senses.sense_definition: A type of angel in religious or mythological texts believed to watch over the human realm.

examples.text: Ancient legends describe a <w>watcher</w> who descended from the heavens to earth.
The story focuses on a fallen <w>watcher</w> who rebelled against the divine order.
